Advanced Key Manager Quickstart¶

Getting started¶

Having inputs display in your game is also a quick and easy process. First you need to add the BP_KeyManagerComponent to your custom PlayerController blueprint.

Next, add an AnyKey input event and call the following nodes on your newly added component from within your PlayerController blueprint:

This will send input received by the ``PlayerController directly to the AKM input system.``

Now that input is set up, you can display it many different ways. The easiest would be to duplicate the DebugWidget from the Examples folder. This will allow you to show the current active Action Preset automatically.

Create and spawn your duplicate of this widget from the BeginPlay` node of your PlayerController blueprint.

Adding an action preset¶

Action presets are an easy way to show a specific set of inputs depending on your situation. For example, the player needs to know he can jump, fire and reload when on foot. However, once you’ve gotten into vehicle, inputs for handbrake, accelerate, etc… are needed. That’s where Action presets come into play.

To create an action preset, go into the defaults of your added BP_KeyManagerComponent and find the ActionPresets variable. Once you find it, click the + to add a new

Now, set a name for the preset, and add all of the inputs that you want to display to the the ActionContexts of that preset.

Note

The actions you set here must be the exact names of the action bindings you set in your project input settings!

Now call SetActionPreset from anywhere.

Now when you play, you should see your input bindings shown on the screen!

Now you can start adding presets and showing input in different ways! I highly recommend going back the full project and picking apart all of the examples as they go deeper than what was shown here!
